channel.title: 100petabit per second kilometre
channel.description: http://anonym.to/?http%3A%2F%2Fwww.alcatel-lucent.com%2Fwps%2Fportal%2Fnewsreleases%2Fdetail%3FLMSG_CABINET%3DDocs_and_Resource_Ctr%26amp%3BLMSG_CONTENT_FILE%3DNews_Releases_2009%2FNews_Article_001797.xml%26amp%3Blu_lang_code%3Den thats fuckin awesome speeds, thats an actual speed of 15.5 tbits per second

item.title: 100petabit per second kilometre
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:22, topic:306623”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=402765.msg2988325#msg2988325 date=1255151097]

http://anonym.to/?http%3A%2F%2Fwww.alcatel-lucent.com%2Fwps%2Fportal%2Fnewsreleases%2Fdetail%3FLMSG_CABINET%3DDocs_and_Resource_Ctr%26amp%3BLMSG_CONTENT_FILE%3DNews_Releases_2009%2FNews_Article_001797.xml%26amp%3Blu_lang_code%3Den
thats fuckin awesome speeds, thats an actual speed of 15.5 tbits per second

I think that’s more than 15.5 TB/S. They said 100,000,000 GB/S and a TB = 1000 GB. So more like 100,000 TB/S? That sounds ridiculous.

We aren’t talking hard drive manufacturers here, we are talking actual amounts.

1TB = 1024GB, not 1000GB.
[/quote]

Sorry for rounding?[/quote]

But that difference accounts for the discrepancy you thought you found but doesn’t really exist.

Read full topic

item.title: 100petabit per second kilometre
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

its a bit like rounding a foot to be 10 inches or a stone to be 10 pounds

item.title: 100petabit per second kilometre
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:12, topic:306623”][quote author=Niall link=topic=402765.msg2985343#msg2985343 date=1254941671]

It says 400 DVD’s a second, most DVD’s are what, 4.7GB ? 4.7*400 = 1880 GB/s

dual layer DVD’s are twice as big as standard 4.7GB/s

But it doesn’t say dual layer?

ya but dual layer DVDs are still often called DVDs and you would expect them to send the largest thing they could

Blueray, anyone?
[/quote]
bluray you douchebag[/quote]
blu-ray you douchebag

Read full topic

item.title: 100petabit per second kilometre
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:6, topic:306623”][quote author=inertia link=topic=402765.msg2983937#msg2983937 date=1254841363]
They need to work on increasing internet transmission speeds. Transmitting at 15 Tb/s in a lab is great and all, but the internet isn’t two computers linked together and that’s what most organizations need at the moment.
[/quote]

If I’m not mistaken, they actually tested the connection on a line of 7000km.[/quote]

In a residential area with thousands of terminals to one base in the back room of an old abandoned BT office? My point was that it’s not yet practical for the internet. Nobody actually said it was either, it was just implied in the context of the report.

Read full topic
